name: abutilon
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of evergreen bush (= one that does not lose its leaves) often grown in gardens, with single bell-shaped flowers: Abutilon are ideal for a cottage garden. The stately home gardens feature an impressive collection of abutilons, abelias, and azaleas. Abutilon is a trailing shrub with strange, dangling red and yellow flowers.
More examplesFewer examplesThe flowers of the abutilon have largish flowers that look a bit like Chinese lanterns with their delicate petals that overlap slightly with one another.The yellow flowers of this abutilon never fail to make me smile. I have two varieties of abutilon in my garden, one with lilac flowers and the other with red ones.
